page.title: 01Between Russ Hill & Ruspers
page.content: The area predominantly consists of rough farmland which is gently undulating to the southwest of the area, towards Ruspers, and very flat to the north west of the area near Russ hill. The fields of rough grazing land are either fenced with wooden posts and wire or consist of fairly low hedges. The landscape is dotted with trees of mixed variety. Near Russ hill (sq 3) there is Gawick 200 and Airanes which attract large numbers of people in the summer. Apart from this, the area is sparsely populated with farms, which are a mixture of dairy and sheep Towards Russ hill there is more woodland,mainly deciduous with a few conifers.
